snippet: If there is no agreement by midnight on Monday, the union’s leader said, a strike against all three American auto makers in Canada will begin.
abstract: Canadian Auto Workers union president Ken Lewenza, despite making progress with the Ford Motor Co of Canada during contract talks, renews his threat to strike all three Detroit automakers, which include Canadian branches of General Motors and Chrysler.
lead_paragraph: If there is no agreement by midnight on Monday, the union’s leader said, a strike against all three American auto makers in Canada will begin.

headline.main: Canada Auto Workers Chief Renews Threat Strike
headline.print_headline: Canada Auto Workers Chief Renews Threat Strike
